meanings.definition: Relating to or denoting a speed of airflow around an object that is close to, but below, the speed of sound.
meanings.sent1: The plane experienced a transonic airflow during its flight.
meanings.sent2: The transonic speed of the jet caused a sonic boom.
meanings.sent3: The transonic wind whispered secrets to the trees.
meanings.sent4: Her transonic thoughts raced faster than the wind.
meanings.sent5: The transonic sensation felt like a gentle breeze on a hot day.

meanings.definition: Capable of traveling at or near the speed of sound.
meanings.sent1: The transonic aircraft broke the sound barrier effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: The transonic car zoomed past the competition on the racetrack.
meanings.sent3: The transonic rocket sang a high-speed lullaby to the stars.
meanings.sent4: His transonic reflexes saved him from the speeding bullet.
meanings.sent5: The transonic speed of the train made time stand still.
